item.title: Medvedev attacks Ukraine leadership
item.description: Russia’s president waded into neighbouring Ukraine’s presidential election campaign, attacking the incumbent as ‘anti-Russian’ and urging the next leader to co-operate with Moscow

item.title: GM’s Volt boasts 230 miles per gallon
item.description: General Motors revealed that its Chevrolet Volt plug-in hybrid car would boast fuel consumption of 230 miles per gallon in city driving making it far more efficient than rival environmentally friendly cars.

item.title: CIT delays filing second-quarter results
item.description: Struggling US small-business lender delayed filing its second-quarter results with the SEC, saying its restructuring efforts meant it could not meet the deadline without ’unreasonable effort or expense’

item.title: Financials lead Wall Street lower
item.description: Financial stocks led the US market lower with equities set for their worst day in more than a month amid signs that the effects of the financial crisis are still being felt

item.title: Madoff aide to face 10 criminal charges
item.description: Prosecutors are preparing to file 10 criminal charges against Frank DiPascali, who is due in court over his role in Bernard Madoff’s $65bn Ponzi scheme

item.title: Tata secures private funding for Jaguar
item.description: The Indian owner of Jaguar Land Rover has dropped its demands for a large bail-out by the British government after obtaining private sector funding for the struggling carmaker

item.title: Fed under spotlight on interest rates
item.description: US Federal Reserve policymakers end a two-day meeting on Wednesday with a statement that could provide a hint of a sigabout the timing of interest rate rises, but no more.

item.title: China’s economy cools as lending slows
item.description: China’s surging economy slowed slightly in July as state-controlled banks heeded Beijing’s instructions to rein in excessive lending, with the volume of new lending dropping 77 per cent from a month earlier

item.title: Eunice Kennedy Shriver dies at 88
item.description: Eunice Kennedy Shriver, who founded the Special Olympics and is a member of one of the most prominent American political families of the 20th century, died at the age of 88
